question: The UNESCO World Heritage Site "Roskilde Cathedral" is located in which country?
explanation: Roskilde Cathedral, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is located in the Zealand Island of Denmark. It was built in the 12th and 13th centuries and was Scandinavia's first Gothic cathedral to be built of brick and it encouraged the spread of this style throughout northern Europe. It has been the mausoleum of the Danish Royal Family since the 15th century.
